item.title: Benchmarking Code in Python
item.description: When I first started programming I started to get the hang of for-loops and I basically applied them to everything that was iterable. Upon learning more about efficient coding for data science, I learned about vectorization (mostly through R and pySpark), so I wanted to showcase a simple case study as to when vectorization reigns supreme over for-loops.

item.description: Co-Founder Inertia7.com (July 2017 - today) Contributed to over 30% of the open-source data science knowledge base on the web application Increased website traffic with integration of Data Science @ UCSB and Data Science Inc. item.title: Site Purpose
item.description: Not too long ago, I decided that website creation wasn’t my cup of tea, so finding a purpose to build and maintain a website (besides putting on resume) was my first step in this site’s creation.

item.title: About Me
item.description: My name is Raul Eulogio. I’m an aspiring data scientist. I started this website for the purpose of blogging and documenting my own self learning. If you have any questions or want to collab hit me up! All opinions and views are my own and do not represent my employer or affliated organizations.
